intro: Phacelia polystachya, commonly known as the Sierra phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive, slightly serrated edge. Phacelia polystachya is valued for its ornamental appeal and serves as a food source for various pollinators.
